metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16845 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
nginx before versions 1.15.6, 1.14.1 has a vulnerability in the ngx_http_mp4_module, which might allow an attacker to cause infinite loop in a worker process, cause a worker process crash, or might result in worker process memory disclosure by using a specially crafted mp4 file. The issue only affects nginx if it is built with the ngx_http_mp4_module (the module is not built by default) and the .mp4. directive is used in the configuration file. Further, the attack is only possible if an attacker is able to trigger processing of a specially crafted mp4 file with the ngx_http_mp4_module.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16845` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nginx - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9
nginx-common - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9
nginx-core - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9
nginx-extras - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9
nginx-full - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9
nginx-light - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9
nginx-naxsi - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9
nginx-naxsi-ui - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> module is built in the nginx-extras package

criterions.comment: nginx package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9').
